variables.description: The source code of your Lambda function. You can point to a file in an Amazon Simple Storage Service             (Amazon S3) bucket or specify your source code as inline text.
variables.name: Code

variables.description: The name of the function (within your source code) that Lambda calls to start running                   your code. For more information, see the Handler property in the                      AWS Lambda Developer Guide.
variables.name: Handler

variables.description: The amount of memory, in MB, that is allocated to your Lambda function. Lambda                   uses this value to proportionally allocate the amount of CPU power. For more                   information, see Resource                      Model in the AWS Lambda Developer Guide.
variables.name: MemorySize

variables.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) execution role that                   Lambda assumes when it runs your code to access AWS services.
variables.name: Role

variables.description: The runtime environment for the Lambda function that you are uploading.  For                   valid values, see the Runtime property in the AWS Lambda Developer Guide.
variables.name: Runtime

variables.description: The function execution time (in seconds) after which Lambda terminates the                   function. Because the execution time affects cost, set this value based on the                   function's expected execution time. By default,  Timeout is set to                      3 seconds.
variables.name: Timeout

variables.description: The ARN of the Lambda function, such as                         arn:aws:lambda:us-west-2:123456789012:MyStack-AMILookUp-NT5EUXTNTXXD.
variables.name: Arn
